Join ASA & IEFC!
Cohort Default Rate for Foreign Schools Webex
National FFELP guarantor American Student Assistance® (ASA) and The International Education Finance Corporation (IEFC) have designed an on-line training series to discuss some of the most pressing topics affecting U.S. financial aid at international universities. These events are designed specifically for international institutions.
Date and Time: Wednesday, February 13, 2008 from 15:00 - 16:00 GMT
Course Description: FY 2006 Draft Cohort Default Rates will be released on February 11, 2008 to all eligible schools http://ifap.ed.gov/eannouncements/012808IFAPPreCDR.html . Learn what’s behind your school’s Cohort Default Rate, how it affects you, and how to read your report.
Topics include: Benefits and Sanctions, Challenges, Appeals, Corrections, and other actions you can take concerning your cohort default rate.
Who Should Attend
Any financial aid administrator interested in learning more about their Cohort Default Rates.
How You Will Benefit Participants will gain a clear understanding of what’s behind their Cohort Default Rates.
How to register or for additional information. · Register Online at http://www.amsa.com/fap/training · Email: send your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com · Phone: call the Training Department at (800) 999-9080 or (617) 728-4200, ext. 3099
All American Student Assistance training events are offered free of charge, however the dial in conference call will be at international rates for a call to the United States.
